title: copy-file: add a mode to provide a full copy of annex information for key(s) not not url "transfer"
body:
`copy-file` operates by reading out urls for a key and populating a file in the new dataset using those url(s).  

Pros:
- backend (and other possible custom settings of the new clone) migration happens if it is needed

Cons:
- works only for keys with urls from remotes, all other remotes availability information is not transfererd
- (probably, didn't check) would "serialize" s3 availability of exported to S3 files as "urls" instead of copying .rmet (like openneuro ones)

During initial discussion of `copy-file` implementation (TODO: find issue/PR) an alternative implementation with a full copy of information from annex seemed more evolved and was not needed for the usecase at hands (hcp) so was not attempted. But I think in many scenarios (in particular for e.g. `mv` #1193) it would beneficial to support a "full transfer" which also probably could be faster and not even require data to be present locally to instantiate keys in destination (git files should be copied)

- key (symlink) is copied to the destination dataset (possibly under a different name/path)
- information from `git-annex` branch for the key is copied into `git-annex` branch of destination
  - need to look out for [the `annex.tune` options](https://git-annex.branchable.com/tuning/) which AFAIK we have not used but could be defined
- (special) remotes information should also be copied (if not yet known at destination) based on the UUIDs found in the key annex .lo
- backend of the key doesn't need to match the default really, just need to be supported
